versions.name: GCP Storage Bucket Permissions Modification v102.0.0
versions.description: Identifies when the Identity and Access Management (IAM) permissions are modified for a Google Cloud Platform (GCP) storage bucket. An adversary may modify the permissions on a storage bucket to weaken their target's security controls or an administrator may inadvertently modify the permissions, which could lead to data exposure or loss.
author: Elastic
false_positives: Storage bucket permissions may be modified by system administrators. Verify that the configuration change was expected. Exceptions can be added to this rule to filter expected behavior.
versions.setup: The GCP Fleet integration, Filebeat module, or similarly structured data is required to be compatible with this rule.
